definitions.definition: the throwing back by a body or surface of light, heat, or sound without absorbing it.
an amount of light, heat, or sound that is reflected by a body or surface.
an image seen in a mirror or shiny surface.
examples: Marianne surveyed her reflection in the mirror

definitions.definition: a thing that is a consequence of or arises from something else.
examples: a healthy skin is a reflection of good health in general
synonyms: evidence "your hands and nails are a reflection of your well-being"

definitions.definition: a thing bringing discredit to someone or something.
examples: it was a sad reflection on society that because of his affliction he was picked on

definitions.definition: the conceptual operation of inverting a system or event with respect to a plane, each element being transferred perpendicularly through the plane to a point the same distance the other side of it.

examples: he doesn't get much time for reflection

definitions.definition: an idea about something, especially one that is written down or expressed.
examples: reflections on human destiny and art
